Mutton Stew

Salt To Taste 
Leeks And Celery(optional) 1 Teaspoons 
Carrots/turnips 1 Numbers 
Potatoes 2 Numbers 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Jaggery 1 Tablespoons 
Coconut Milk 1/2 Cup 
Flour 1 Teaspoons 
Whole Garam Masala 4 Numbers 
Curd 1/2 Cup 
Chopped Onion 1 Numbers 
Vinegar 1 Tablespoons 
Black Pepper 5 Numbers 
Gr Chilli 2 Numbers 
Chopped Tomato 1 Numbers 
Jeera 1 Teaspoons 
Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Mutton 500 Grams 
Peas 1 Teaspoons 
POPPY SEEDS PASTE 1 Teaspoons

In a bowl take mutton add flour and mix.Take a pan add oil and mutton into let it cook till golden brown colour.\nOnce it is done take pressure cooker with little water into it and add the grilled muttion into it and cook till mutton is tender. Take a pan add oil,bayleaf,masalas,onion,ginger garlic paste,poppy seeds paste,coconut powder and mix well let it cook for 2min now add tomatos chopped finely and mix well.Now add curd,coconut mik,vinegar,if you want add jaggery,green chillies and add all vegetables,water close with a lid and cook for 5-10 min.Now remove the lid once vegetables are cooked add cooked mutton into it and cook for 5min by closing with a lid in a very slow flame.lastly add coriander leaves and switch off the flame.
Spicy Lamb Chops

Maida 1 Pinch 
Pepper Pdr 
Sugar 
Lamb Chops 10 Numbers 
Corn Oil 150 ml 
Vinegar 2 Tablespoons 
Lemon Juice 15 ml 
Salt To Taste 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Chilli Pdr 1 Teaspoons 
Fresh Coriander Leaves 1 Teaspoons 
Curd 3 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons

1.For Lamb chops first need to marinate them.
2.Take a bowl add curd,red chilli powder,pepper,salt,vinegar,sugar,corinder powder,coriander leaves,lime,flour and mix well.Now add this mixture to lamb chops and mix well. 
3.Take a non stick pan add oil to it then add the marinated chops into the pan evenly and cook for 5 min and turn over and close with a lid cook in very low flame for at leat 20 -30 min keep turning in between.
4.Cook till they become tender and golden brown colour.
Kheema Mattar

Pepper 4 Numbers 
Gr Peas 1 Bunch 
Potato 1 Numbers 
Coriander Leaves 1/2 Bunch 
Tomato Chopped 3 Tablespoons 
Plain Yogurt 2 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Cumin Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Red Chilli Powder 1/4 Teaspoons 
Turmeric Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Cardamom 2 Numbers 
Cinnamon Stick 2 Piece 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Garlic 3 Clove 
Onions 1 Numbers 
Groundlamb 1 Pound 
Gr Chilli 1 Numbers

1.In a pot heat the oil. When it gets hot add in the garam masala cumin onions and saute well . 
2.Add in all spices ginger garlic paste and stir well. 
3.Add ground meat tomatoes and and yogurt, stir and saute on medium heat for about 20 minutes 
4.When ground meat is well done add in the cooked peas; potaotes (small pieces mix and simmer to heat throughly. season and garnish with coriander pdr and garam masala can do the same with chicken,beef,turkey meat
Achari Gosh

Lamb 2 Lbs 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Onion 1 Cup 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Turmuric Powder pinch Pinch 
Water as needed 
Coriander Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Red Chilli Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Methi Seeds pinch Pinch 
Mustrad Seeds 1/2 Teaspoons 
Zeera 1/2 Teaspoons 
Kaloongi 1/2 Teaspoons 
Saunf 1/2 Teaspoons 
Chironji 1/2 Teaspoons 
Till Seeds 1/2 Teaspoons 
Cumin Seeds pinch Pinch 
Bell Pepper Green 1 Numbers 
Salt as per the taste 
Curd 1 Cup 
Sugar pinch Pinch 
Coriander Leaves 1 Bunch 
Lemon 1 Numbers 
Ginger 1 Numbers

1.Take a presure cooker add oil,onion,salt cook till the onions are brown colour then add gingergalic paste,turmuric mix well now add mutton.Now add little water,coriander powder,red chilli powder mix well and close it with the lid and cook till mutton is tender.
2.Now for the achari powder take a pan add methi seeds,murstard seeds,zeera,kaloongi, saunf,chironji, till,mix all well till they are fried and blend them.Take the same pan add oil cumin seeds,methi seeds,kaloongi,blended paste,cook it the oil loses out
3.now add the gravy of lamb which was cooked in the presure cooker let it cook. 
4.Now once sauce is thick add mutton, salt,curd and mix well cook for 10 min in slow flame, sugar optional.
5.Finaly add coriander leaves,chillis,ginger slice,lemon.
Seena With Raisins Curry

Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Garam Masala Podwer 1/2 Teaspoons 
Coconut Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Cumin Powder 1/2 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Salt As needed 
Cumin Seed 1 Teaspoons 
Vinegar 1 Teaspoons 
Garam Masala Dry 2 Numbers 
Onions 1 Cup 
Rasins 10 Numbers 
Mutton Seena Pices 500 Grams 
Coriander Leaves 1 Springs

1.Take a blender Add rasins,red chillis, onions,vinegar blend it till a fine paste.Take a presure cooker, oil, garama masala, cumin seeds, onion mix well add salt, ginger garlic paste.\n2. add the blended paste cook for 2 min then add seena mutton,corinader powder, cumin powder, coconut powder mix well if required add water and close it with a lid cook till mutton is tender.Onces the mutton remove the lid and cook till water evaporates then garama masala powder, chopped coriander.
Paya -Attu kalu curry

Turermic Powder pinch 
Ginger and Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Curry Leaves Leaf 
ONION 1 Big 
Bayleaf 3 Leaf 
CARDMOM SEEDS 2 Numbers 
Cinnamon 2 Numbers 
Shah Zeera pinch 
CLOVES 2 Numbers 
Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Lamb Legs 8 Numbers 
SALT To Taste 
Green Chilles 3 Big 
Coconut Powder Freshly Made 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons
Garam Masala Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Pepper Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Red Chill Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Corainder Leaves 1 Bunch

1. Clean Lamb Legs with little turmeric and water and keep it aside.
2. Take Pressure Cooker add oil to it then add masalas, bayleaf, onions chopped, mix it little bit then add curry leaves, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, Green chillies and salt as per taste mix these ingredients.
3. Now add Lamb legs to this mixture, mix it well and add water as required and close the pressure cooker with the lid, let it cook for atleast 30 min in slow flame.
4. Once the lamb legs are cooked then add coconut powder, Coriander powder, garam masala powder, pepper powder, red chill powder and mix all these ingredients well.
5. Cook for another 10 to 15 mins if you want more soup you can add some more water into it.
6. Lastly add chopped corrinader leaves and serve.
Kheema Mutti Indian Meat Patties

CORIANDER LEAVES Bunch 
Salt To Taste 
Pepper Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Garam Masala Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Turermic Powder 1 Pinch 
Giner Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Coconut Powder Freshly Made 1 1/2 Tablespoons 
RED CHILLI POWDER 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
OIL FR FRYING 3 Cup 
Kheema (Minced Mutton) 2 Lbs 
Egg 1 Big

1. Wash Kheema in a bowl
2. Add Red chilli powder,coconut powder,coriander powder,ginger garlic paste,turermic powder,garam masala powder,salt mix all this finely.
3. Lastly add coriander leaves chopped and egg to bind the mutti.
4. Take a frying pan add oil into, take khemma mixture into your hand make into small dumplings and fry in slow flame till golden brown colour.
Liver Masala

Water As needed 
Coriander Leaves 1 Bunch 
Lemon 1 Small 
Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Garama Masalas 2 no each Numbers 
Onions 1 Cup 
Corinader Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Coconut Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Turmeric 1 Pinch 
Salt 1 To Taste 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Red Chili Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Liver 500 Grams

1.Take a bowl add liver pieces into it add some milk to it and soak for 30min and then wash it with water, then add pinch of red chilli powder,salt,oil,ginger garlic past and mix it well.
2.Now take a nonstick pan add little oil then add the spices mixed liver pieces into it and saute them and let it cook for 5min and transfer it to another plate.
3.Take the same pan add oil, garama masalas, onions,ginger garlic paste,turmeric, mix them then add red chilli powder,coriander powder,coconut powder saute them add little water and let it cook for 5-10 min in very low flame.
4.Once masala is cooked add the cooked liver pieces into it and close with a lid cook for 2-3 min in slow flame.
5.After 3min remove the lid add some chopped coriander leaves if required lemon juice and serve.
lamb pepper chops curry style

Pepper Powder 1 1/2 Teaspoons 
Butter 1 Teaspoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Coconut Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Red Chilli Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Salt as per taste To Taste 
Curry Leaves 7 Leaf 
Turmeric Powder pinch Pinch 
Ginger Garic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Onions 1 Cup 
Oil 1 1/2 Tablespoons 
Garama Masala 2 each Numbers 
Lamb Chops 500 Grams 
Coriander Leaves 1 Bunch 
Garam Masala Podwer pinch Pinch

1.Take Lamb chops wash and keep a side.
2.Take a presurecooker add oil,garamasalas, chopped onions mix well then add gingergarlic,turmeric,curry leaves,salt to taste,red chilli powder,coconut powder,coriander powder saute little bit then add chops into it mix well and add some water and close with presure cooker lid and cook for 15min.
3.Once the chops are cooked keep it a side, take a non stick pan add butter, chopped garlic,pepper powder, some more curry leaves and mix well now add the cooked chops to this mixture.
4.Cook this in very slow flame till it changes colour to brown or till the masala sticks to the chops.Lastly add coriander leaves chopped and garama masala powder.Serve with roti or rice
Dappadam - Lamb Kadi

Coriander Leaves 1 Bunch 
Garam Masala 1/2 Teaspoons 
Rice Paste 2 Teaspoons 
Tamarind Juice 1/2 Cup 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Red Chill Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Water As needed 
Curry Leaves 1 Bunch 
Green Chillies 4 Numbers 
Salt as per taste 
Turermic Powder 1 Pinch 
Ginger and Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Onions 1 Cup 
Garama Masalas 2 each Numbers 
Bayleaf 4 Numbers 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Lamb Bones 500 Grams

1.Wash Lamb bones in water and keep it to a side.Soak rice in little water for 30min and make into a fine paste. 
2.Take a Presure cooker add oil, garama masalas,bayleaf,onions saute them and then add ginger garlic,turermic, salt, green chillies, and curry leaves and mix well for 2 min.
3.Now add the lamb bones saute them and add water as need,red chilli powder,coriander powder,mix well and close with lid and cook for 10-15 min in slow flame.
4.Once lamb bones are cooked add tamarind juice,water if need, coconut powder and let it come for boil. 
5.Now add the rice paste very slowly to the boiling lamb bones and mix well then add garamasala powder and coriander leaves chopped let it cook for 5 min and remove from flame and serve hot with roti or pulkas.
Gongura mutton curry

Green Chillies 5 Numbers 
Turermic Powder pinch 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Onion 1 Cup 
Garama Masalas 2 each Numbers 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Salt as per taste 
Red Chilli Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Cumin Seeds Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Mutton 500 Grams 
Gongura Leaves 5 Bunch

1.Take mutton in a presure cooker add cumin,coriander,red chilli powder,water,and salt mix and close it with the lid cook till the mutton is tender.\n2.Now in a pan add oil,garama masala,onions,salt cook till onion change colour to golden brown,now add ginger garlic paste,turemuric powder,green chillis,gongura leaves mix well and cook in a very slow flame till oil oozes out then addcooked mutton to it.cook for 5 min add some water if required then add garamasala powder, coriander leaves serve with rice or roti.
Botti Curry

Coconut 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Turmuric pich 
Ginger Garlic 1 Tablespoons 
Salt as needed 
Dry Garamasala 2 Numbers 
Garama Masala 1/2 Teaspoons 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Red Chilli Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Boti 500 Grams 
Coriander Leaves 1 Bunch

1.Clean in hot water and cut all the meat and keep it a side.
2. Take a pan add oil, garamamasal, onion chopped, salt,mix well then add ginger garlic,turmuric,all meat and mix well if required add water to cook.
3.Now add coroander powder, coconut powder,red chilli powder mix well cook till meat is tender if required presure cook.
4.once meat is tender add garamamasala,coriander chopped.
Bhuna Ghost

Methi Leaves 3 Bunch 
Water as needed 
Red Chilli Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Coriander Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Mutton 500 
Green Chillies 3 Numbers 
Turmuric pinch 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Teaspoons 
Onion Sliced 1 Cup 
Bayleaf 
Oil 1 Tablespoons 
Bell Pepper 1 Numbers 
Garamasala Powder as needed 
Chopped Coriadner 1 Bunch 
Salt to taste

1.Take a pressure cooker add oil, garamasala dry,bayleaf, sliced onions,salt cook till onions are golden brown colour then add ginger garlic paste, turmuric, green chillies mix well.\n2.Now add mutton mix well add, red chilli powder, coriander powder, water mix well and cook till mutton is half cooked.now remove the pressure cooker lid and transfer the cooked mutton to a pan add methi leave, bell pepper and cook till all the water is dryied out keep mixing till it is dry.\n3.Lastly add garamasala powder and chopped coriander leaves.
Sweet Meat Balls

Gingergarlic Paste 1/2 Teaspoons 
Turmuric pinch 
Green Chillies 4 Numbers 
Coriander Pwd 1/2 Teaspoons 
Red Chilli Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Garamasala pinch 
Pepper Pwd 1/2 Teaspoons 
Water as needed 
Coriander Leaves 2 Springs 
Salt as per taste 
Onion 1 Numbers 
Cumin Seeds pinch 
Butter 1 Tablespoons 
Kapuras 5 Numbers

1.In a pan add butter, cumin seeds, chopped onions, salt mix well now add the kapurs cut into 4 parts mix well, now add ginger garlic paste, turmuric, green chillies , red chilli pwd, coriander pwd, mix well cook for 10 min by closing a lid. \n2.After 10-15 min remove the lid add garamasala, pepper pwd, coriander leaves mix well switch of the flame and serve hot
Hyderabadi Haleem

Cinnamon 3 Numbers 
Cadodom 1 Teaspoons 
Pepper Corn 2 Tablespoons 
Channa Dal 
Urad Dal 
Red Gram 
Wheat Whole 250 Grams 
Mutton 1000 Grams 
Cloves 1 Tablespoons 
Kabob Chinni 2 Tablespoons 
Barely

1.Clean and marinate mutton with half of ground paste of ginger, garlic, green chillies and salt for 1 hour. Pressure cook the soaked wheat and marinated meat for about 45 minutes. \n2.Mince and grind to a fine paste. In a Pan heat oil, add the finely sliced onions, fry till brown, add the garam masala. Add the ground paste and keep stirring on slow flame, till the mixture leaves the sides of the pan.\n3. Serve hot, with lime wedges
Empanada Pastry Pockets

Egg 2 Numbers 
Vinegar 1/2 Cup 
Baking Soda 1/4 Teaspoons 
Coriander Chopped 1 Bunch 
Salt To Taste 
Potato 1 Numbers 
Chilly Powder 1 Tablespoons 
Cumin Powder 1 Teaspoons 
Raisins 8 Numbers 
Bell Pepper Chopped 1/4 Cup 
Chopped Carrots 1/2 Cup 
Green Peas 1/2 Cup 
Green Chilly Chopped 2 Numbers 
Garlic Chopped 1 Teaspoons 
Onion Chopped 1 Numbers 
Olive Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Lamb Meat 500 Grams 
All Purpose Flour 1 Cup 
Garam Masala 1 Tablespoons 
Butter 1 Tablespoons

1. Heat the olive oil in a pan add chopped onions, once the onions are sautéed, add chopped garlic, chopped green chilly, cumin powder, add small pieces of potatoes, small pieces of carrot, green peas, and add mince meat, chilly powder mix all this, lid on and let it cook for medium flame for few minutes.\n2. Add, salt, bell pepper, add raisins, cook for some time, add chopped coriander, garam masala, keep it aside, let it cool For the dough Take a small bowl add egg, vinegar, salt and water, and mix it, Take a bowl add all purpose flour, baking powder, add butter and pour the mixture (eggs, vinegar) and mix it like a dough, make a big sheet and cut them in to a round disc and apply the egg wash and stuff the meat mixture inside, and press the edges and deep fry the pockets /pot stickers. Serve hot this with chutney.
Barbecue Flavoured Lamb

Tomato Ketchup 1 Tablespoons 
Crush Pepper 3 Tablespoons 
Soya Sauce 1 Teaspoons 
Red Chilly Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Onion 1 Numbers 
Jaggery/brown Sugar 1 Teaspoons 
Green Apple 1 small Piece 
Sugar 1 Teaspoons 
Yogurt 2 Tablespoons 
Ginger Garlic Paste 1 Tablespoons 
Chilly Powder 2 Tablespoons 
Oil 2 Tablespoons 
Salt To Taste 
Lamb 500 Grams 
Fig 2 Numbers 
Pine Apple 5 small Piece 
Sweet Potato 3 small Piece

1. Take a bowl add chilly powder, salt, ginger garlic paste, yogurt, jaggery, oil, mix it well. 
2. In this add lamb pieces, and marinate them, keep it in the refrigerator over night. 
3. Take marinated lamb pieces add paste of green apple and onion. And add red chilly paste, Soya sauce, salt, sugar, crush pepper, tomato ketchup, and mix it well and keep it aside for 1 hour.
4. Take a pan put it on the flame in a medium heat, add lamb pieces, cook it for few minutes. 
5. In this add figs, sweet potato, pine apple, let them sauté it.
Rogan Josh mutton

Fennel Powder 4 Teaspoons 
Jeera 1 Teaspoons 
Kashmiri Red Chili Powder 2 Tablespoons 
Yogurt (Curd) 1/2 Cup 
Cloves 4 Numbers
Green Cardamon 1 Numbers 
Black Cardamom 4 Numbers 
Hing 2 Pinch 
Mustard Oil 3 Tablespoons 
Lamb (Shoulder Cut) 2 Lbs 
Ginger Powder 1/2 Teaspoons 
Water 1 Cup 
Salt 1.5 tsp To Taste

1.Wash, cut and pat dry meat Heat Mustard oil in a deep pan till smoke comes out. Reduce heat and add to oil - Hing, Jeera, 4 Cloves, Black Cardamom(2 whole+2 crushed), 1 whole green cardamom, slow fry till fragrance comes out. \n2.Add meat to oil and fry till it becomes evenly brown (takes about 6 minutes medium heat) Add yogurt and stir well. Slow cook till evenly mixed (without lumps or white color) that water evaporates from yogurt and oil separates (med-low flame) Add Kashmiri Red Chili Powder to meat (Red chilli will stick to the meat at this point, stir for about 1 min) Add 3 tbsp water (if you feel the meat is too dry and the chili powder will get burnt) Add 1/4 cup of water (just enough to cover the meat) Add Fennel Powder, Ginger Powder and cook few minutes Add Salt and fold Slow cook for about 1.5 hours on stove (or about 3 hours on slow cooker) sprinkle ground Jeera powder and green elaichi 2 pinch (optional) (If you dont have time you may pressure cook the meat, or reduce the cooking time and adjust the heat accordingly and by checking the tenderness of the meat while cooking)
